page.title: 02ROADS IN BOWERCHALKE
page.content: The Parish lies l0 miles SW of Salisbury to which it naturally looks for services. The main thoroughfare through the Parish from Salisbury is a minor mettalled road. This has been well repaired this year following neglect & bad deterioration. There is no enforced speed limit: blind corners & hidden drives are hazardous. The road branches at thhe Post Office: one road goes NW to meet the road from Broad Chalke to Shaftesbury. The other road continues through Woodminton to the Parish & County boundaries (1 mile), then on to the village of Sixpenny Handley & A354 (6 miles). There is one branch before Woodminton; it goes SE & connects a few dwellings with A354. Heavy lorries use the village road as a short cut to Wilton from a local farm business and from the A354.
